{"id":310603421,"lang":"python3","time":"1 year, 4 months","timestamp":1583688863,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"68 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/310603421/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers II","memory":"12.6 MB","code":"# Definition for singly-linked list.\nclass ListNode:\n    def __init__(self, x):\n        self.val = x\n        self.next = None\n\nfrom collections import deque\nclass Solution:\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1, l2):\n        if not l1 and not l2:\n            return None\n        st1, st2 = [], []\n        cur1 = l1\n        while cur1:\n            st1.append(cur1.val)\n            cur1 = cur1.next\n        cur2 = l2\n        while cur2:\n            st2.append(cur2.val)\n            cur2 = cur2.next\n        \n        add_one = False\n        sum_ls = deque([])\n        while st1 or st2:\n\n            if st1 and st2:\n                val = st1.pop(-1) + st2.pop(-1)\n            elif not st1:\n                val = st2.pop(-1)\n            else:\n                val = st1.pop(-1)\n\n            if add_one:\n                val += 1\n            if 10 <= val:\n                add_one = True\n            else:\n                add_one = False\n            sum_ls.appendleft(val % 10)\n        \n        if add_one:\n            sum_ls.appendleft(1)\n        head = ListNode(sum_ls[0])\n        cur = head\n        for i in range(1, len(sum_ls)):\n            cur.next = ListNode(sum_ls[i])\n            cur = cur.next\n        return head\n\n\n\n            \n                \n\n            \n        \n        \n        ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers-ii"}
